schemes.name: PM-KISAN (Pradhan Mantri Kisan Samman Nidhi)
schemes.description: Direct income support of ₹6,000 per year to all farmer families in three equal installments of ₹2,000 each, every four months.

eligibility.land_holding: All small and marginal farmer families
exclusions: Farmer families with income tax liability

application_process.contact: Village Revenue Officer or Agricultural Extension Officer

schemes.name: PMFBY (Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana)
schemes.description: Comprehensive crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss/damage arising out of unforeseen events.

benefits.coverage: Complete crop cycle from pre-sowing to post-harvest
benefits.government_subsidy: Remaining premium paid by Central and State Government

eligibility.crops: All food crops, oilseeds, annual commercial/horticultural crops
eligibility.farmers: All farmers including sharecroppers and tenant farmers

coverage_risks: Drought, Flood, Hailstorm, Cyclone, Fire, Lightning, Storm, Landslide
Post-harvest losses (drying period up to 14 days)

schemes.name: KCC (Kisan Credit Card)
schemes.description: Credit facility for farmers to meet their production credit needs for cultivation and allied activities.

benefits.credit_limit: Based on cropping pattern and land holding

features: Flexible repayment schedule aligned with harvesting and marketing

schemes.name: Soil Health Card Scheme
schemes.description: Government scheme to issue Soil Health Cards to farmers every two years to provide information on nutrient status of their soil.
services_provided: Soil sample collection from farmer's field
Soil Health Card with nutrient status
Fertilizer recommendations for next crop cycle

application_process.contact: Village Level Worker, Agricultural Extension Officer, or Soil Testing Laboratory
application_process.sample_collection: From farmer's field by trained personnel

schemes.name: PKVY (Paramparagat Krishi Vikas Yojana)
schemes.description: Scheme to promote organic farming through cluster approach and organic certification.

benefits.additional_support: ₹3,000/ha for certification and ₹2,000/ha for residue analysis

eligibility.formation: Cluster of 50 or more farmers (minimum 50 hectares)

components: Organic inputs like bio-fertilizers and bio-pesticides

application_process.mode: Group application through State Agriculture Department
application_process.contact: District Collector or State Agriculture Mission

schemes.name: Sub Mission on Seeds and Planting Material
schemes.description: Comprehensive program for development of seed production and distribution system for quality seeds.

benefits.seed_subsidy: 50% on seeds of high yielding varieties
benefits.infrastructure_support: Financial assistance for seed storage and processing units

eligibility.area_requirement: Minimum area as per crop and category

application_process.contact: State Seed Corporation or Directorate of Agriculture

schemes.name: National Agriculture Market (e-NAM)
schemes.description: Pan-India electronic trading portal which networks existing APMC mandis to create a unified national market for agricultural commodities.

benefits.services: Online trading platform for better price discovery

eligibility.registration: Free registration for farmers and traders

features: Single license valid across all integrated markets

schemes.name: Micro Irrigation (PMKSY-Per Drop More Crop)
schemes.description: Component of PMKSY focusing on water use efficiency at farm level through micro irrigation systems.

eligibility.minimum_area: 0.5 hectares for individuals, 5 hectares for groups

application_process.contact: District Irrigation Officer or Horticulture Officer
application_process.approval: Technical approval followed by financial sanction

metadata.source: Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India
